formattedAddress: 343 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 343 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: A cozy room with 70's vibes & a menu featuring an array of modern American snacks, fare, & drinks.

originalText.text: Very delicious! Has a great atmosphere with wonderful decor. Everything on the menu looked like something I wanted to try. Food was excellent and not too filling. Also had a great cocktail list. Seating was comfortable. Service probably could have been better but besides that we had a great time!

text.text: Very delicious! Has a great atmosphere with wonderful decor. Everything on the menu looked like something I wanted to try. Food was excellent and not too filling. Also had a great cocktail list. Seating was comfortable. Service probably could have been better but besides that we had a great time!

originalText.text: Really cute spot with tasty main options and a sweet happy hour. We got the Baby Gem Caesar, the Rigatoni and the Pan Seared Branzino. Along with the happy hour drinks (wine + Little Buddha beer).

text.text: Really cute spot with tasty main options and a sweet happy hour. We got the Baby Gem Caesar, the Rigatoni and the Pan Seared Branzino. Along with the happy hour drinks (wine + Little Buddha beer).

originalText.text: Cute place with a wonderful assortment of food. We had the crab linguine and the pan roasted branzino. Both delicious!! The staff is friendly and welcoming. A place I would definitely return to.

text.text: Cute place with a wonderful assortment of food. We had the crab linguine and the pan roasted branzino. Both delicious!! The staff is friendly and welcoming. A place I would definitely return to.

originalText.text: Reserved tables for my boyfriend's birthday here. As someone who likes to be on top of plans, I was disappointed by the help i got from their organizer who set up our tables. He wasn't attentive with my questions and took him several days to respond. One of the inquiries I've had was requesting tables closest to the bar as it gets too crowded at the back. I did not get a reply from him until I followed up and he said that we were able to book the tables we wanted. But at that night, we were seated at the tables at the very back of the room. I've been patient and was friendly throughout with him but it felt like we were not a priority at all. I suggest if you're booking a table for a birthday, do it way ahead of time so you can wait days for a response to your questions. However, the service we got from our server that night was exceptional. She made sure that we were taken cared of and always checked on us. The atmosphere was also a great vibe for a birthday. I just wished we had the same experience with their organizer.

originalText.text: This restaurant is a poorly run establishment and has the audacity to host large parties. They placed our dinner party in a middle of a crowded dance floor where anyone can come up to our table and order drinks without knowing. Food service was extremely delayed where we got our entres an hour and a half after we arrived. The food was not evenly distributed throughout the party due to how crowded the dance floor was with random people. Many of my friends complained they did not get food and can't believed they paid $65 for a prefixed menu. You're better off ordering individually because it'll be cheaper and have more food than ordering from the prefixed menu. I highly do not recommend this place for hosting dinner parties as it is stressful to host in a terribly crowded setting and lack of management responsibilities. Both the servers and costumers get the short end of the stick while the restaurant profits off a massive margin.
